Package com.gpch.mongo.service

Class JobService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gpch.mongo.service.JobService

  • @Service
public class JobService
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Gage Hoefer This class functions as the primary point of contact for all service methods involving Job objects- it relies on the built in services offered by the JobRepository class. These services include saving job objects in the database, deleting job objects both in general and by a specific id, and manipulating job objects in various ways.

public JobService​(JobRepository jobRepository)

    • Method Detail

      • saveJob

        public Job saveJob​(Job job)
        Parameters:
        job - This method is given a Job object, and uses an instance of the JobRepository class to save the Job to the database.

      • getAllJobs

        public java.lang.Iterable<Job> getAllJobs​()
        Returns:
        Iterable This method uses an instance of the JobRepository class to retrieve all Job objects stored in the database, returning them in the form of an iterable list of Jobs.

      • deleteAllJobs

        public void deleteAllJobs​()

      • deleteJobById

        public void deleteJobById​(java.lang.String id)
        Parameters:
        id - This method is given a String representing an id for a specific Job stored in the database, and uses an instance of the JobRepository class to delete the job based on said id.

      • findJobById

        public java.util.Optional<Job> findJobById​(java.lang.String id)
        Parameters:
        id -
        Returns:
        Optional This method is given a String representing an id for a specific Job stored in the database, and uses an instance of the JobRepository class to retrieve the job based on said id; it returns the Job in the form of an Optional object of type Job.

      • setJobId

        public void setJobId​(java.lang.String id,
                     java.lang.String job_id)
        Parameters:
        id -
        job_id - This method is given a String representing an id for a specific Job stored in the database, and a String representing a job id; with these, it uses an instance of the JobRepository class to set the job id of the Job object.

      • setJobType

        public void setJobType​(java.lang.String id,
                       java.lang.String job_type)
        Parameters:
        id -
        job_type - This method is given a String representing an id for a specific Job stored in the database, and a String representing a type of job; with these, it uses an instance of the JobRepository class to set the job type of the Job corresponding to said id.
